title: Urgent need to increase women’s participation in national economy: PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasised the urgent need to increase women’s participation in the economic sector, both globally and in Sri Lanka.

title: CSE ramps up investor confidence
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) is looking to build on its strong performance last year, when it ranked as the world’s second-best performing stock market in dollar terms, despite the signs of early 2025 market consolidation.

title: ADB urges Sri Lanka to fast-track sustainable finance to attract global investment
byline: Sri Lanka must accelerate the adoption of sustainable financing frameworks to attract the global investors and strengthen its long-term economic resilience, the Asian Development Bank (ADB) said yesterday.

title: Startup Nation Initiative kicks off to elevate local entrepreneurial ecosystem
byline: Sri Lanka this week saw the launch of Startup Nation Initiative, a revolutionary effort to elevate the country’s entrepreneurial ecosystem to next level.

title: China executed four Canadians for drug crimes, says Ottawa
byline: Four Canadians were executed in China on drug-related charges earlier this year, Canadian authorities have confirmed.

title: Gazette issued revising import export regulations
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued, revising multiple import and export regulations, including a significant update permitting Bureau Veritas inspection certificates for vehicles imported from all countries.

title: Deshabandu is more dangerous than Harak Kata: ASG Deelipa Peeris
byline: Additional Solicitor General Dileepa Peeris yesterday informed the Matara Magistrate’s Court that Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon is a more dangerous organized criminal than Harak Kata and Makandure Madush.

title: Magistrate orders charge sheet to be served on Arjuna Aloysius over Rs. 12 million printing paper fraud
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawela today ordered that the charge sheet on Arjuna Aloysius be officially served on April 30 over a case pertaining to an alleged fraud of Rs. 12 million linked to a purchase of printing paper for newspaper production.

title: Suspect remanded for marriage scam impersonating CID officers
byline: An individual who had multiple warrants issued on him nationwide, for defrauding victims through a marriage advertisement scam by impersonating a CID officer, was further remanded till April 3 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Tension between registered and non-registered safari jeep owners at Yala
byline: A heated argument broke out between registered and non-registered safari jeep owners in front of the Yala National Park, as the Wildlife Department continues its annual practice of registering new jeep batches, the Yala Safari Jeep Owners’ Association (YSJOA) said.

title: Adani refutes offering to revise pricing in energy project in SL
byline: The Adani Group refuted media reports that they have offered to revise the pricing to 7 cents per kilowatt-hour in the wind power project in Sri Lanka.

title: Deshabandu further remanded
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon was further remanded till April 3 by the Matara Magistrate today.

title: UNP to decide on mayoral candidates next week: Sagala
byline: The United National Party (UNP) will decide on its mayoral candidate next week, its National Organizer Sagala Ratnayake said today.

title: Govt. decision to arrest deserters of security forces unreasonable: Namal
byline: The government’s decision to arrest deserters from the security forces on the basis of having links with underworld is unreasonable, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa said today.

title: LG polls to be held on May 6
byline: The Election Commission has announced that the Local Government elections will be held on May 6.

title: U.S. Indo-Pacific Commander in Sri Lanka
byline: The Commander of the U.S. Indo-Pacific Command (INDOPACOM), Admiral Samuel J. Paparo, is in Sri Lanka on an official visit from March 19 to 21.

title: ICFS hosts Ayubowan UK event for aspiring  students
byline: The International Center for Foreign Studies (ICFS) is excited to announce an exclusive event, Ayubowan UK, designed for Sri Lankan students who dream of studying in the United Kingdom. This event will offer vital financial support, including sponsorships and scholarships, to help students navigate the process of studying abroad.

title: Perpetual Treasuries paid funds worth Rs. 1.08 billion to various persons: Minister
byline: Perpetual Treasuries owned by Arjuna Aloysius had paid cheques worth Rs. 1.08 billion to 108 persons, Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Price of milk tea to increase by Rs.10 from April
byline: The price of a cup of milk tea will rise by Rs.10 from April 1 due to the increase in the price of a 400g imported milk powder packet, the All Island Canteen and Restaurant Owners’ Association (AICROA) said.

title: Bimal, Harsha exchange words in Parliament
byline: Opposition MP Harsha de Silva and Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayke engaged in an exchange of words in Parliament today over affairs of  the Public Finance Committee.

title: Tax on cigarettes must be increased: Harsha
byline: The tax imposed on cigarettes is coming down over the past few years and a new decision must be taken in parliament regarding the cigarette tax, Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF) Dr. Harsha De Silva said today.

title: Digitalization can eliminate financial corruption: CSSL
byline: Following the country’s rapid digitalization, all corruption related to financial management can be eliminated through digital procedures, Computer Society of Sri Lanka (CSSL) Vice President Indika De Zoysa said.

title: Deshabandu is more dangerous than Harak Kata: ASG Dileepa Peeris
byline: Additional Solicitor General Dileepa Peeris yesterday informed the Matara Magistrate’s Court that Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon is a more dangerous organized criminal than Harak Kata and Makandure Madush.
